intro: Argostemma lamxayanum, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, typically in humid, shaded environments.
